intro: Descurainia heterotricha, commonly known as the hairy tansy, is an annual flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, as well as small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and other open areas. Descurainia heterotricha is often considered a weed but has been studied for its potential ecological and medicinal properties.
